content: Language Intelligence and MAchine Learning (LIMaL) Lab – Homepage of CHEN Yun, focus on NLP and machine learning from SUFE Skip to main content CHEN Yun (陈云) Associate professor School of Information Management & Engineering Shanghai University of Finance and Economics yunchen[at]sufe[dot]edu[dot]cn [Google Scholar] Biography I am an associate professor in SUFE, working on natural language processing. I received the Ph.D.  degree from The University of Hong Kong in 2018, under the supervision of Prof. Victor O.K. Li, and received the bachelor degree from Tsinghua University in 2013. I was a visiting scholar with the Tsinghua Natural Language Processing Group and NYU CILVR Group. Before joining SUFE, I worked as a phonetic & semantics researcher at Huawei Noah’s Ark Lab in Hong Kong during 2018-2019. I served as an AC for EMNLP 2022, CCL 2023 and an reviewer for ACL, EMNLP, AAAI, COLING, AACL, AIJ, FCS, TALLIP, JCST. I have broad research interests in machine learning and natural language processing. Currently, I am mainly working on large language model and multilingual multimodal learning. Positions avaliable: Master/PhD program students. 招收博士生、硕士生和本科生，欢迎有志于研究生成式人工智能的学生加入本课题组！请附简历邮件联系 What’s New? 2025-08. We have two papers accepted by EMNLP 2025 conference,Pi-SQL: Enhancing Text-to-SQL with Fine-Grained Guidance from Pivot Programming Languages, and G2: Guided Generation for Enhanced Output Diversity in LLMs 2025-07, I will serve as an Area Chair for Arr 2025 July 2025-05. We have three papers accepted by ACL 2025 conference,ImPart: Importance-Aware Delta-Sparsification for Improved Model Compression and Merging in LLMs, TAG-INSTRUCT: Controlled Instruction Complexity Enhancement through Structure-based Augmentation,and FANNO: Augmenting High-Quality Instruction Data with Open-Sourced LLMs Only 2025-01. We have four papers accepted by NAACL 2025 conference,MiLoRA: Harnessing Minor Singular Components for Parameter-Efficient LLM Finetuning, SeqAR: Jailbreak LLMs with Sequential Auto-Generated Characters, FinEval: A Chinese Financial Domain Knowledge Evaluation Benchmark for Large Language Models and LayAlign: Enhancing Multilingual Reasoning in Large Language Models via Layer-Wise Adaptive Fusion and Alignment Strategy 2024-09. We have two papers accepted by NeurIPS 2024 conference, SeTAR: Out-of-Distribution Detection with Selective Low-Rank Approximation and Delta-CoMe: Training-Free Delta-Compression with Mixed-Precision for Large Language Models 2024-09. We have one long papers accepted by EMNLP 2024 main conference, Distract Large Language Models for Automatic Jailbreak Attack 2024-05. We have two long papers accepted by ACL 2024 (one main conference, one findings), LoRA-Flow: Dynamic LoRA Fusion for Large Language Models in Generative Tasks  and PACIT: Unlocking the Power of Examples for Better In-Context Instruction Tuning 2024-03.
